info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Berks County through 615 PM EDT... At 544 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wernersville, or 9 miles west of Reading, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Reading, Wyomissing, Birdsboro, Sinking Spring, Wernersville, Robesonia, New Morgan, Spring Ridge, Shillington, West Reading, Mohnton, Kenhorst, Wyomissing Hills, West Lawn, Lorane, Whitfield, West Wyomissing and Flying Hills. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 296 and 299. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
